title: Chapter 43
body:
Chapter 43


If Su Li was still the freshman mangaka when “Pure Romance” was yet to gain any fame, her acts of confronting or threatening the editor would totally be in the path of seeking troubles. That could forfeit her future prospect of becoming a prominent mangaka.


But it was the high time now, as “Pure Romance” was gaining all the spotlight. Ever since her personal identity was revealed to the public, the number of her fans had been increasing. Any readers who had a sheer knowledge of the manga world, would definitely know of the sudden entrance of this one beautiful-girl mangaka.


There was a great solidarity between Su Li’s fans on internet. “Pure Romance” had an individual page on Qidian website, in which any new acquirement of silver Sect Master is globally announced, although she could earn only a quarter of the reward. This had given her a notion of publishing her works straight on Qidian main page…


Even in Zhao Youyue’s class, a student named Jiang Chao had clinched his teeth merely to save up 100 RMB to tip Su Li. This was a huge amount for a student from an average. Anyway, Jiang Chao did it out of his own will, as he liked Su Li and her manga from the bottom of his heart. If Su Li have any new serialization of manga, he would continue supporting her.


All in all, now Su Li was highly emboldened. Even if she picked up a fight with “Wind Manga”, she would not be worried about losing her job. This is what known as a talented and capricious person.


Moving one step backwards, you would notice that even if she solely continued drawing some books, she could also earn a huge sum. If she announced to the people that Su Li and Wang Li were both the same people, her total book sales would exceed the number you could have imagined.


Anyway, Wei Suo was simply out of ideas to change Su Li’s perspective. He always thought that Su Li was the kind of mangaka that was bounded by reality. Everything would be revolving around money and popularity, in which she had to treat every reader wholeheartedly, ensuring they could read her creation happily. Since it was a commercialized manga, it had to be delectable and an enjoyable one after reading it. Moreover, he could still remember the way Su Li criticized those hipster mangakas who inflicted bad feelings to the readers a couple of times. How could she possibly become likewise?


Having said that to create a legend through manga, we had never seen any top enthusiastic manga creating the so-called legend through this method…


Without any choice, Wei Suo had to bring the bag having the original draft to the chief editor, and also convey Su Li’s determination. Since he could do nothing with Su Li, the chief editor would be the decision maker. Actually, he had not looked into the ending thoroughly, he was just flipping through without pay attention to the tiny details. But he could feel that the ending would be an absolute disappointment to the readers.


After Wei Suo left, her personal assistant Zhang Ziqiang was looking at Su Li with full respect, and said, “Master Su Li, you are a genius! But aren’t going a bit too far? Of course, I’m standing by your side about the ending. It’d really make ‘Pure Romance’ remembered eternally by the readers. The characters in the story will become the legendary characters as well…”


Su Li heaved a sigh. She had felt that she was not in her usual mood. Perhaps she had not recovered from the time when her ideas were bursting in, as well as the feeling of entering the manga world to witness everything by herself. But options were limited and she desperately wanted all her readers to know the real ending of this manga by hook or by crook, instead of simply making up a harmonious ending.


“Another thing, you had promised the readers on your Weibo that you will come out with a cheerful ending…”


“Isn’t this ending cheerful enough? Darkened forms will ruin one’s life and the scumbag guy must die, aren’t these full of positive energy?”


“Hehe… you are right.”


“Great, our collaboration will end here. Let us settle the assistant’s payment.”


“Alright, Master Su Li.”


Zhang Ziqiang had schemed through the truth. Su Li decided to give her readers “positive energy”. He felt that if he had the chance to become a serial mangaka, he’d also wanted to learn from someone like Su Li with a positive mind.


…


In the “Wind Manga” editing department, Yin Lang the chief editor was deliberately going through the final ending of “Pure Romance”. Sitting beside him was the restless Wei Suo. He was afraid when Yin Lang read up to the part of plot twist, he would get outraged and tore up the original draft. In that case, they would have to end their partnership with Su Li…


Albeit not paying full attention to the original draft, Wei Suo was aware that the ending was any scribblings of Su Li. Instead, she had demonstrated the best of her drawing skills in portraying this final ending. The scenes were so doughty, which was not a good thing, as it could have a tremendous impact on the mind of the readers!


“Great! This is amusing!” Yin Lang suddenly hit against his working desk and gasped in admiration, “This kind of badass male protagonist should be tortured to death, this is truly remarkable!”


Wei Suo was feeling dumbfounded while looking at his very own chief editor. He spoke gently, “But the main character just died like that, wouldn’t this be fooling the readers? It’s terrible… and totally doesn’t match the reader’s expectation. Don’t forget Master Su Li’s promise to the readers on Weibo. She had specified that the ending of ‘Pure Romance’ would be a harmonious one and every character would live happily.”


Yin Lang frowned a bit while thinking about this matter. But he had no words but continued reading it. Until the last part of ending where the extremely pretty Xu Jing in lily white dress was holding her book and strolling towards the sea, he again hit on his working desk and hollered, “Su Li this fellar was out looking for trouble! Surprisingly, a good girl like Xu Jing didn’t have the chance to live a happy life with Yang Xixi, this is so frustrating!”


After seeing Yin Lang stamping his foot, Wei Suo could not help rolling his eyes. Unexpectedly, the chief editor with bushy eyebrows and big eyes had also abandoned the revolution and went astray. No wonder when he saw the male protagonist, Yang Ming was set to death, he was grinning from ear to ear, just like a kid who weighs 100kg…


After a while, Yin Lang calmed himself down and sat on his chair, restoring his pride as a chief editor. He adjusted his eyeglasses, then stuck both of his hands to the desk and placed his lower jaw on his hands. With his eyeglasses emitting bare coldness, he slowly said, “I was reading the final ending of ‘Pure Romance’ using the normal readers’ perspective just now. In all fairness, the male protagonist’s death was really delightful, but the tragedy faced by Xu Jing was too much. However, considering what Xu Jing had done previously, if Xu Jing was let to stay alive, this would show the deviation of moral values, as if we were encouraging the readers to win someone’s heart by fair means or foul. To possess someone by hurting others, this twisted action was totally wrong. The darkened Xu Jing was still pitiful yet detestable…”


Yin Lang gave his comments about the ending with a steady pace, but Wei Suo was not calm enough. Impatiently, he asked, “Chief Editor Yin, should we ‘Wind Manga’ publish this ending?”
